chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ercilio Medina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.  Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  To be taken from DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance and supervision fees to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to revocation sentence in 10CF2229.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Mental health evaluation. Follow treatment protocol.  Take all medications as prescribed.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs, take as long as deemed medically reason.
No alcohol.
No contact Salish P.
No contact with Subway 839 W. Historic Mitchell Blvd, City and County of Milwaukee, WI.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Court recommends Micah Program as requested by defense program.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ercilio Medina

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order has been electronically transmitted to DOC. jj
Amendment To Judgment Of Conviction And Order - ERP
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 34, Judge Yamahiro. jj

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (33 pages) commencing on 05-16-2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING received and filed.

Defendant Ercilio Medina in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Ercilio Medina in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, charging defendant as follows:

Robbery (Threat of Force), a Class E Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.32(1)(b) and 939.50(3)(e).

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Ercilio Medina not in court, in custody.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ercilio Medina in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ercilio Medina in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Satish P., Sanjay P., or Subway Restaurant at 839 West Mitchell Street, Milwaukee, Wisconsin.  Copies provided to defendant, defense counsel and the State.

Defendant Ercilio Medina in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ercilio Medina in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report reviewed by all parties; neither State nor defense counsel challenge its findings.  Court had colloquy with defendant and defendant replied that he, too, believes he is competent.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Defense counsel requested a preliminary hearing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ercilio Medina in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Ercilio Medina in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
